history.provenance: Canterbury, Kent, Benedictine abbey of St Augustine (originally of St Peter and St Paul): that is identifiable in the Catalogue. A fragment (one leaf), the first of the manuscript, ending on verso 'in quibus osten-'; so corresponds to entry 357 in the Catalogue,'Augustinus de trinitate cum B, 2 o folio 'detur filius'. (MLGB3: inferred evidence).
From bindings of printed books and MSS.

recordHist.source: Typescript description by Bodleian library staff. Partly described in the Summary Catalogue. Summary Catalogue, vol. 5, p. 842

listBibl.head: Printed descriptions:
listBibl.bibl: S. J. P. van Dijk, Latin Liturgical Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, Oxford, vol. 6: Fragments - Office Books, Rituals, Directories (typescript, 1957), p. 121

ref.title: MLGB3: Medieval Libraries of Great Britain

decoDesc.decoNote: Light blue initial and first line.

supportDesc.extent: one leaf. The leaf should be reversed.

msItem.title: Legendary
msItem.note: End of St.Patroclus (B.H.L. 6520), Acta Sanct. Jan. II. 343, and beginning of St. Vincent (B.H.L. 8628) Acta Sanct. Jan. II 394.

msItem.author: Peter Lombard
msItem.title: Sentences
msItem.note: I dist.26. The leaf should be reversed.

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: Enarrationes in Psalmos
msItem.note: Ps.126. For other leaves of this MS. see N. R. Ker, Pastedowns in Oxford bindings, p. 140, no. 1534.

msItem.title: Collectiones (?)
msItem.note: A leaf perhaps from a volume of collectiones: the recto contains meditations, the verso Isidore Synon. I 55–7.

msItem.title: Commentary on Peter Lombard, Sentences
msItem.note: (bk. III; cols. numbered and lines numbered by fives, in a large hand)

msItem.author: Jacobus de Voragine
msItem.title: Legenda Aurea
msItem.note: St. Ignatius - Purification, ed. Graesse pp.157–160.

msItem.title: Treatise on vices
msItem.incipit: Ira est ut ait Augustinus ulciscendi libido

msItem.author: W. Lyndwood
msItem.title: Provinciale
msItem.note: V. tit 14 end - tit.15 beg., pp.448–454 in the 1664 Oxford ed.

msItem.author: Jacobus de Voragine
msItem.title: Legenda Aurea
msItem.note: St. Peter, ed. Graesse pp.376 and 379.

msItem.title: Sermons
msItem.incipit: Ecce mulier chananea … Hec mulier chananea potest significare animam per penitentiam commutatam

msItem.title: Forms of excommunication
msItem.note: Incl. the Bull of Boniface VIII against the poor men of Lyons.

msItem.title: Patristic text
msItem.note: Work similar to the Vitae Patrum.

msItem.title: Subject index to the works of the two Senecas

history.provenance: From the same MS. as the following item, a sister MS. of MS. Add. C. 12 (S.C. 24755).

supportDesc.foliation: Numbered in red CLVII and CLXVIIII.

history.provenance: From the same MS. as the preceding item, a sister MS. of MS. Add. C. 12 (S.C. 24755).

msItem.author: Ranulph Higden
msItem.title: Polychronicon
msItem.note: ed. Babington, Rolls Series I, pp.198–222 and 308–332.

decoDesc.decoNote: Illuminated initial in blue, rose and scarlet on a gold ground with partial border.

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: Enarrationes in Psalmos
msItem.note: Ps. 50, P.L. 36 col. 594–5. See N. R. Ker, op.cit., p.108, no.1159.
